body_html:
Oups, I create a new conda environment from scratch each time I try something new, and this time I accidentally created a 2.7 env.
Anyway, with 3.6, if I install first pybind11 (conda install -c conda-forge pybind11) and then pip install . on the fasttext directory, everything is fine:

Processing /home/tannier/tools/fastText/git-clone/fastText
Requirement already satisfied: pybind11>=2.2 in /home/tannier/.conda/envs/testsegfault7/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from fasttext==0.8.22) (2.2.3)
Requirement already satisfied: setuptools>=0.7.0 in /home/tannier/.conda/envs/testsegfault7/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from fasttext==0.8.22) (39.2.0)
Collecting numpy (from fasttext==0.8.22)
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/68/1e/116ad560de97694e2d0c1843a7a0075cc9f49e922454d32f49a80eb6f1f2/numpy-1.14.5-cp36-cp36m-manylinux1_x86_64.whl
Building wheels for collected packages: fasttext
  Running setup.py bdist_wheel for fasttext ... done
  Stored in directory: /tmp/pip-ephem-wheel-cache-wg0ihwrd/wheels/fb/60/2d/209375f56b4bf3e6f0cb758d0a7e4d2a2ff10aa8b8a3b6caaa
Successfully built fasttext
Installing collected packages: numpy, fasttext
Successfully installed fasttext-0.8.22 numpy-1.14.5

So fasttext seems to install fine, the error messages were just due to the fact that pybind11 was not found, but it installed it finally... But it doesn't change anything to my fasttext+torch segfault problem.

Next update in next comment.

body:
Oups, I create a new conda environment from scratch each time I try something new, and this time I accidentally created a 2.7 env.
Anyway, with 3.6, if I install first pybind11 (`conda install -c conda-forge pybind11`) and then `pip install .` on the fasttext directory, everything is fine:

```
Processing /home/tannier/tools/fastText/git-clone/fastText
Requirement already satisfied: pybind11>=2.2 in /home/tannier/.conda/envs/testsegfault7/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from fasttext==0.8.22) (2.2.3)
Requirement already satisfied: setuptools>=0.7.0 in /home/tannier/.conda/envs/testsegfault7/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from fasttext==0.8.22) (39.2.0)
Collecting numpy (from fasttext==0.8.22)
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/68/1e/116ad560de97694e2d0c1843a7a0075cc9f49e922454d32f49a80eb6f1f2/numpy-1.14.5-cp36-cp36m-manylinux1_x86_64.whl
Building wheels for collected packages: fasttext
  Running setup.py bdist_wheel for fasttext ... done
  Stored in directory: /tmp/pip-ephem-wheel-cache-wg0ihwrd/wheels/fb/60/2d/209375f56b4bf3e6f0cb758d0a7e4d2a2ff10aa8b8a3b6caaa
Successfully built fasttext
Installing collected packages: numpy, fasttext
Successfully installed fasttext-0.8.22 numpy-1.14.5
```

So fasttext seems to install fine, the error messages were just due to the fact that pybind11 was not found, but it installed it finally... But it doesn't change anything to my fasttext+torch segfault problem. 

Next update in next comment.
